    Estimation of anchor transformation

    get_W.Rd

    Estimates the anchor transformation for the Anchor-Objective. The anchor transformation is \(W = I-(1-\sqrt{\gamma}))\Pi_A\), where \(\Pi_A = A(A^TA)^{-1}A^T\). For \(\gamma = 1\) this is just the identity. For \(\gamma = 0\) this corresponds to residuals after orthogonal projecting onto A. For large \(\gamma\) this is close to the orthogonal projection onto A, scaled by \(\gamma\). \(argmin_f ||W(Y - f(X))||^2\) corresponds to the Anchor-Regression Estimator (Bühlmann 2020) .

    Usage

    get_W(A, gamma, intercept = FALSE, gpu = FALSE)

    Arguments

    A

    Numerical Anchor of class matrix.

    gamma

    Strength of distributional robustness, \(\gamma \in [0, \infty]\).

    intercept

    Logical, whether to include an intercept in the anchor.

    gpu

    If TRUE, the calculations are performed on the GPU. If it is properly set up.

    Value

    W of class matrix, the anchor transformation matrix.

    References

    Bühlmann P (2020). “Invariance, Causality and Robustness.” Statistical Science, 35(3). ISSN 0883-4237, doi:10.1214/19-STS721 .

    Author

    Markus Ulmer

    Examples

    set.seed(1)
n <- 50
X <- matrix(rnorm(n * 1), nrow = n)
Y <- 3 * X + rnorm(n)
W <- get_W(X, gamma = 0)
resid <- W %*% Y
